alert.note: Alert for Alger; Baraga; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Luce; Marquette; Northern Schoolcraft; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 15 at 3:21PM EDT until March 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected Thursday night and Friday followed by lake effect snow Friday night into Saturday. Snowfall amounts in excess of 6 inches can be expected especially in the higher terrain areas and north to northeast snow belts. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph especially near the Lake Superior shoreline and in higher terrain and open areas. * WHERE...Portions of central Upper and western Upper Michigan. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact multiple morning and evening commutes from Thursday evening into Saturday. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will be preceded by a period of rain tonight into Thursday before a change over to snow Thursday night. This may lead to slick road conditions Thursday night into early Friday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
